documents.title: halcyon theuri inquest : taxi driver 'heard bump '
text: a taxi driver 's told an inquest into the death of a man in alfreton that he heard `` a bump '' on the road where his body was found .
alan bramley told derby coroner 's court that he drove along wingfield road on the same night halcyon therui 's body was found .
he was coming towards the end of a long shift and heard a `` speed bump '' like noise as he approached alfreton but he maintained that was n't at the same spot mr theuri died .
earlier a home office pathologist told the inquest the 21-year-old chef died because of a head injury - most probably caused by the hard edge of a vehicle .
the hearing will continue tomorrow .
author: Lisa Teanby
Newsreader, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: teaching assistants to resume strike action
text: school support staff in derby are to take six days of strike action against cuts to their pay .
unison said staff will take action on wednesday and thursday next week , as well as the following monday and tuesday and 19-20 january .
it follows a vote last week in response to a revised offer from the city council .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: avian flu : 'every farmer 's nightmare '
text: derbyshire poultry farmer roger hoskins , who runs highfield happy hens in etwall , has had to put all 24,000 hens indoors .
he said : `` it 's a bit like the foot and mouth , every farmer just has nightmares because it finishes you off really .
`` if all of our hens were destroyed , we 'd have to pay for our place to be cleaned out and i do n't think we would ever start again . ''
author: Martyn Williams
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: 'miracle ' as girl defies predictions to walk
text: a nine-year-old girl from derbyshire is beginning to walk despite doctors telling her parents she would n't be able to .
hannah toon , from melbourne , was just eight months old when her parents were told the `` heartbreaking '' news .
she was born with a rare genetic disorder and an incredibly severe form of epilepsy .
having gone through years of physio treatment and with the help of a walking device , hannah is walking and engaging with people .
her family have described it as `` a miracle '' .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live
